reviewText: Good family show.  It is about life and choices which is a good show to have discussions on.
This show was the best - worth watching!!

Love this series
Wish it did not have to come to an end

I have always loved Jane Seymore in the Dr Quinn series. Its also a very wholesome movie as well. One that you can sit down with the whole family and not worry about being embarrassed about certain parts.

I'm so sad that I have completed the show, because now I have nothing good to watch. I loved how it was clean and family friendly, but didn't hesitate to talk about problems or situations within family life. This show made me worry, cry and laugh with the actors. After every single episode, I wanted to watch another one (sometimes I did  watch more than 1,2, or 3 in a row). I absolutely recommend this show!

Perfect for pre-teen girls!

I LOVED this show growing up but now that I've watched it as an adult, I can see how it shaped my perception of family values, and strong, honorable women.  I have two boys now and their interest was a little piqued as they saw me watching as well... Good stuff!

I would just like to say I Like Dr. Quinn and her show , but IT IS A SHOW ! I have read reviews about people saying how we as America stole the lands from the Indians. THERE IS ONLY A LITTLE BIT OF TRUTH TO THAT ! The reason I'm writing this review is to let people know that the main cause of the Indians death and disappearance was when Columbus and the Spain settlers landed in central America and began to spread the measles within the Indian tribes. Then when the English settlers came to north America they spread the measles as well. This killed over 80% of the Indian population , and it was accidental not genocide because the Indians had no immune defense to this disease. Now, I will state that Columbus  did some things to certain Indians down in central America such as enslave them, massacre them, and take things from them, but not on the same level that we did. He went way to far; he was trying to get things with conquest. I will admit as well that we shouldn't have done some of the things that we did to them such as, make them march the trail off tears, to move west, and in some cases our army did some things that they shouldn't , but if you look back; the different tribes stole land and fought amongst  each other. They would massacre each other for land and power. They would practice the conquest ethic ,whichever  tribe was more powerful would conquer the others. We gave the Indians reservations. They could be prosperous and build stores or farm, or continue there way of life like they still can today. WE were very generous to the  Indians and not cruel to them all the time there even were men fighting in congress for them such as David Crockett. So, I hope you do your homework , like me , and really get the facts of history. America is a great nation and country and people need to read there history book to find what really happened. I enjoy Dr. Quinn ,But, I still keep in mind that it is a TV SHOW FOR ENTERTAINMENT. Thank you if you read this I hope you enjoyed it.
My family & I Absolutely love the complete series. Lifes Trials & Tribulations packed into all seasons and very well done. So sad to see it end.
This was a very welcome change to all the trash on tv now a days.

This season (6) was one of the better ones, not that the others were bad.  Overall the show has stood the test of time. More dramatic episodes in season six was something that kept me interested.  It was nice not having Sully in every episode.  Nothing against the character...well that's not true.  I think his character is so unbelivable.  While the show continuously vents it liberal views, changing history as it does, it's usually done with good taste.  After all its a tv/movie entertainment show and it is entertaining.  A few liberties are allowed.  Except the ridiculous Sully character.  So as I said, it was good having a break from him this season.

You know, television isn't like this anymore.  I remember watching this show when it aired in the 90's and didn't fully understand the stregnth of the episodes.  Great acting and storytelling.  Quite refreshing.
some are boring but some are great
I love this show. Felt sad watching the last few episodes. We don't get this kind of series anymore.
Good show
Best show ever. I wish thy kept going.
Love it !
Loved watching the show because it is just good old fashioned TV with a great story and no swearing and little violence!

As the series last season I was struck by how much I enjoyed being with the people of Colorado Springs.  This season did not leave me hanging as it ended, but I did want to hear more.
The writing was wonderful and the actors made the characters seem alive.
It is a wholesome series for the whole family and I strongly recommend it to all.
Great show for the entire family.
Love it!
Such a great show!
Great
Excellent show was sad when it ended

I enjoyed the six seasons of this series and the two movies that followed.  I especially liked the comment feature at the end of some episodes in which the events of a particular episode are tied in with real historical facts such as the voting rights for women, evolution from stage coach travel cross country to trains, updating of medical procedures like a tracheostomy, how lands were systematically stolen from the Indians, Indians purposely given disease-carrying blankets, etc.  Excellent show with interesting characters.
Wonderful series!  Watched all six seasons without commercials on Prime Time Movies.  Worth watching and time spent!

Great series.  I watched every episode of all six seasons.  Nice to see a clean family friendly series, you don't have many.  Got a little boring to see how stupid people can be portrayed being stupid over and over again, but that was a small distraction.  Thanks for some good entertainment.
Love the good wholesome entertainment
Very good
Present day issues thoughtfully addressed with compassion and understanding, in the context of the 19th century.

Dr. Quinn took a hit the last season. Sully was not highlighted in many episodes.  The show was ending because CBS would not allow any more seasons so many things had to be crammed into one season. Still a great family TV show.
Love Dr. Quinn - Seasons 1-6

This continues to be a good family show. The plot lines are starting to run a bit thin and starting to feel as if the writers are running out of ideas. The new age mind set is becoming more noticeable which puts me off quite a bit. There are two times when I turned off the show due to the heavy atmosphere of new age thinking.
Heart warming, interesting, wonderful.
Love this show
This is a series of shows to remember!!!
Excellent family viewing.
Really enjoyed all of the Dr. Quinn seasons.  Good clean entertainment.  Only wish there were more seasons.
Really enjoyed all six seasons.  Great family show!  We watched it as a family.  Highly recommend!!!!
I loved watching this tv series.!!  There should be more programs like this one.!!
I'm really can't believe it's over.

I have just loved re-watching the entire series and I am sad to see it ends.  There isn't anything else on television quite like it.  I have laughed and cried and I look forward to each and every episode!
I loved it
So sorry it ended.
I have watched seasons 1-6 and I have absolutely loved it. Just wished there were more seasons to watch. That is the only disappointment about this tv series.
Good
Awesome show. I love it. I'm so glad there are services like this where we can go back and watch entire series that we missed years before.
Must watch all time favorite drama from childhood still watch it in good and bad times still all time favorite show
loved ALL 6 seasons.  I have started watching them again ...
Great family show.
Enjoyed the whole series!
Great!
Another great season
Very good.
Great series!
Great Show!
Always compelling and entertaining, there is real heart in this series.
great series
Great to see Dr. Quinn again.
What a great show!
This is a great show for the whole family. It may be a little dated but hey it's the old west and it is a show that has some good values at the heart of it.
Love this show....
Excellent series that draws you in to a time long forgotten.  Wish CBS hasn't canceled it.  A serious you can watch with your whole family!

Love the series, but seriously Amazon NEEDS to work on their shoddy rating system.  My parental settings required me to put my access code in for each episode, yet other (clearly needing to be blocked) make it through.  Step it up Amazon.
Just finished it, love Dr. Mike!
Great series!  Such a pity that CBS cancelled it...
Good, clean entertainment
A good clean show. Wished it had more shows. It made me feel as though I was living in that time period. It really draws you in.
I love the mixture of drama, history and romance.
I watched the entire series.  Great family show.  However, I wish the 2 movies would have followed the last regular show.
Enjoyed the show
I adored it
I love this show!  It reminds me of my child hood!! And it just a great story
I enjoyed the series, good family entertainment.
Great entertainment and beautiful scenery. Great Family Movie series
I love Dr. Quinn! I just wish there was another season.
have watched all 6 seasons loved it wish  there was more like it on would give it 5 stars

Quality family show that shows many of the struggles communities and people dealt with in the mid to late 1800's.
Enjoyed when it was on in the 90's and am enjoying it even more watching it on my kindle!
Love and miss this type of quality TV! Highly recommend for all ages.
Do yourself a favor and watch from beginning to end Seasons 1-6, as you will not be disappointed.
Great!
It was a joyous experience to rewatch this series.
I liked that it completed the loose ends of some of the stories in the series.

One of my favorite shows
Love the characters and good stories
Great show! The grandkids love it!
We missed them on TV SERIES!  We still love to watching!
I'm watching this series over and over -- absolutely love it!
My daughter and I love watching this show together. Great story lines, acting, and wholesome family values.

Hands down my favorite TV series of all time. The romance between Michaela & Sully was so sweet! I also enjoyed all the sociopolitical issues the show addressed. Its a classic that I'll return to for many years to come.
Absolutely love this show!!!!!

What I liked most? Just about everything! I knew when this show was aired back back in
90's but I worked evening or grave-yard shift on my job full time. I had my hands filled with family life
and any spare time was for resting. Never got to watch much.

I was able to watch all of the episodes recently. Feeling sad there are no more to watch.
LOVED DR.QUINN.

My wife and I both still enjoy Dr. Quinn Medicine Woman series. Its dynamic in every way.. Wonderful story lines the kind of shows that leave you feeling good about life.. To bad CBS and all movie making can't be like this.. We also learned a lot about natural herbs to treat conditions that are still around today. All around marvelous entertainment for families giving hope to everyone!
Wonderful Series

So much killing and meanness on TV these days. I watched this series years ago when it aired once a week. I am sorry it ended. There are not a lot of new shows  I am interested in watching these days. I am thankful I can go back and watch reruns of the shows that bring me back to a good place where people treated each other better and if they didn't later in the show somehow the persons not doing right changed their way of thinking.

Dr. Quinn was one of my all time favorites growing up. I remember the same feeling as I do now through out all the seasons. I only wish we could have not seen the morphine women version of this cause sadly it ruined my thoughts on the actors. Why couldn't they have let this be, Just a family mannered show.

I have watched this series a fews times, and love it, there is not a lots of wholesome things to watch so I really
enjoy Dr. Quinn.
Best show ever!  Sad it ended.  Can watch on Amazon Prime, all seasons are available.
